reviewText: Really solid old school shooter, tough missions with large open maps and many different ways to tackle each one. Simple but good. Many custom missions to download that are just as well made as the offical story line ones. The multiplayer is still somewhat active at times. If your looking for a good tactical shooter that has wide open missions then pick this up next time its on sale. Worth the money just to play through the campaign.

reviewText:
Delta Force is an oldschool budget tactical shooter franchise and Black Hawk Down is the 6th installment. Team Sabre is a big expansion pack set in Colombia and Iran. The core gameplay stays the same, but the locations and the difficulty has increased.

The Visuals.
Same as in BHD. BHD has it's own engine and runs at DirectX8, 4:3 aspect ratio resolution. I managed to get it up to 1200p, it refused to go above. All widescreen solutions stretch / cut off the screen. Considering that it's budget titles made in 2003 the visuals are fine. Decent textures, fine poly count and nice drawing distance (like in every other DF title). Framerate is unlimited. Game is compatible with pretty much all Windows versions.

Considering this is an expansion the mechanics and AI haven't been upgraded and are pretty much the same as in the main game. The only minor complaint is that some objectives are buggy and there are some minor friendly AI bugs.

The Audio.
Just like BHD Team Sabre offers nice background music and nice team dialogues.

The Gameplay.
With the expansion you get 5 missions set in Colombia and 6 missions set in Iran. Some new weapons have been added. Unlike in the main game these missions are way longer and more difficult (you get less saves too). The shortest mission is around 10 minutes and the longest one is half an hour+. Missions include village, airfield, jungle, island, oil rig, oil pipeline and even stronghold raids with various insertion methods. Some of these mission offer far more complex maps with lots of buildings and enemies which easily makes this far more interesting than the main campaign itself.

If you liked Black Hawk Down then you'll most likely will like this expansion even more.

reviewText: The Delta Force Series games are wonderfully done and well laid out. With each game there are a bunch of missions to complete and things to blow up. The graphics in these games are old school. The shooting in the games can get frustrating at times because you might get headshot from a AI that you can't see. Just take each level slow and steady and for the most part you can kill enemies really far away since there is no bullet drop. The missions can also get frustrating since if you fail something in the mission you might be put right back at the beginning of the level and might rage quit because it was hard to get to a certain point. Just remember quick save and save alot while playing to avoid frustration. The online portion of these games are still alive, but you might have to go looking in some of these Delta Force games. Ive really enjoyed playing these classics from beginning to end and I know you will too if you are a army buff and enjoy a good old fashion First Person Shooter.

reviewText: Another addition to the Delta Force franchise this game adds to an already large enough campaign, this time you take on cartel drug lords and terrorist even warlords all around the world. It also has some new weapons for you to use and patches many of the bugs that the game previously had. Extending the lifespan of this game considerably. If you wanted to crank out some hours on a quality first person shooter this one is perfect.

reviewText: The Battle of Mogadishu, more commonly referred to as Black Hawk Down or, locally, as the Day of the Rangers (Somali: Maalintii Rangers), was part of Operation Gothic Serpent and was fought on 3 and 4 October 1993, in Mogadishu, Somalia, between forces of the United States supported by UNOSOM II, and Somali militiamen loyal to the self-proclaimed president-to-be Mohamed Farrah Aidid who had support from armed civilian fighters.\n\nA U.S. Army force in Mogadishu, consisting primarily of U.S. Army Rangers from Bravo Company, 3rd Battalion, 75th Ranger Regiment; C Squadron, 1st Special Forces Operational Detachment-Delta (1st SFOD-D), better known as Delta Force"; as well as Air Force Combat Controllers and Air Force Pararescuemen and helicopters from 1st Battalion

reviewText: Another attempt by Novalogic to cash in on military popculture, this one went far better than Task Force Dagger did. It's on a brand new engine that eliminates the bug issues which plagued the previous generation of Delta Force games. While the combat is still very action-based, it's become much sharper, and the missions have returned to being based on realism - indeed, they are loosely based on actual events during the Somalia intervention, with the final string of them depicting the Battle of Mogadishu that is seen in Black Hawk Down.\n\nThe expansion are also pretty good, showcasing an anti-drug operation in Columbia and an intervention during a revolution in Iran.
